summary:
Tenacious and flexibly minded Brewing Science student and musician, passionate about solving problems both common and complex through innovation, a creative application of scientific and technical knowledge.

Enjoys the dynamism of teamwork and the quiet concentration of individual work.

Multilingual national who has lived in 3 countries, excluding his own.

Enjoys playing in string and chamber groups and exploring the outdoors.

Particularly interested in innovation, problem solving and science/technology.

awards.title: Duke of Edinburgh (International Award) Bronze and Silver
awards.description:
A highly prestigious and recognised award across Europe and the UK, with 80 countries participating worldwide.

-I was entrusted with the administrational task of entering the details and achievements of all participants in the school into a database.

-Played in a Piano Violin and Clarinet trio, performing in multiple concerts both at the Centre For Young Musicians (CYM) and at the British School in The Netherlands (BSN).

-Trained towards and participated in the 10 km "Voorschoten Loop" (the running race of the town of Voorschoten, Netherlands) in March 2011.

-Went on a hiking expedition around Chaam, Breda, The Netherlands. Walked 24 km in a team of 4 over the course of 2 days, spending the night in the woods in tents we carried, navigating independently.

-Went on a hiking expedition in the Houffalize area of the Ardennes in Belgium. Walked 60 km in a team of 4 over the course of 3 days, spending 2 nights in tents we carried, navigating independently.
awards.issuer: HRH The Duke of Edinburgh, W.A.M van der Laan and W.O. Baron Bentinck van Schoonheten

awards.title: Prize for Outstanding achievement
awards.issuer: The British School in the Netherlands

awards.title: Junior ISMTF Mathematics Competition, bronze team trophy
awards.description:
Was chosen, after entrance tests, to represent the School at the Junior ISMTF Mathematics Competition in The British School of Brussels as part of a team of 6.
In a a random mixed team stage of the competition, my team of 3 won the bronze trophy.

projects.title: FoNS-MAD innovation competition (Imperial College London)
projects.description:
We have developed and tested a working prototype of a p1000 micropipette with a new internal mechanism.
 
It locks at first stop and is released by the simple push of a button. This reduces the number of strenuous movements made with the thumb while pipetting and provides greater certainty of accuracy as the operator no longer doubts whether they have overshot the first stop or not.

Was in one of 3 teams to secure funding and lab time in Imperial College London after a 6 month competition against others. The final part of the application pre-lab competition was to present our idea to a panel of 3 Judges consisting of Lord Robert Winston, Professor Sir John Pendry and Professor Lesley Yellowlees.

We are currently contacting potential manufacturers for our pipette.

projects.title: A-Level (A2) Biology Coursework (Independent Field Research)
projects.description: Investigated and wrote a coursework paper on the effect of differing weather conditions at different altitudes on the structural density of Broom plants (Cytisus Scoparius) in the Sierra de Gredos mountains, West of Madrid, Spain.

courses.name: Astrobiology and the Search for Extraterrestrial Life (Edinburgh University through Coursera)

profile_positions.description:
Carried out an investigation into the microbiomes of draught beer and cider, focussing on isolation, separation and identification and the effectiveness of line cleaning.

Methods included:
- The forcing test, based on that developed by Horace Brown
- Turbidity measurements with a spectrophotometer 
- Culturing samples on differential media
- ITS PCR & purification
profile_positions.title: MSc Project Student

profile_positions.description: Spent a day (7:00-16:30) in each department of the brewery, following the journey from malt, hops, water and yeast right through to the bottled beer. This was a great opportunity to absorb as much knowledge as possible, both practical and theoretical, from the many enthusiastic employees of this excellent brewery, offering an invaluable insight into the science, logistics and technology at the cutting edge of german brewing.
profile_positions.title: Intern (Schnupperpraktikant)

profile_positions.description:
Collected and analysed data on the photoelectric current of Photosystem II (PSII), specifically investigating electron transfer from Qa, out of PSII (when the electron leaves without interaction with Qb). This data contributed to research done by Katharina Brinkert, PhD Student of Professor Bill Rutherford.
The work involved:
- Making up buffers, herbicides and electron carrier solutions.
- Immobilising PSII on glass electrodes.
- Collecting data using a 3 electrode system in a dark room. (Intermittent, timed, manual illumination 
   with red light). Data was collected on a computer.
- Carrying out the same data collection procedure in anoxic conditions (box filled with Nitrogen gas, 
   degassed from cylinder).
- Data analysis using Microsoft Excel.

These tasks were carried out independently on a regular, almost daily basis.
profile_positions.title: Lab Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Designed, developed and tested a new internal mechanism for a p1000 micropipette.

Was in one of 3 teams to secure funding and lab time in Imperial College London after a 6 month competition against others. The final part of the application pre-lab competition was to present our idea to a panel of 3 Judges consisting of Lord Robert Winston, Professor Sir John Pendry and Professor Lesley Yellowlees.
Design was first drawn as engineering part and assembly drawings with defined dimensions by me and then drawn in Autodesk Inventor by my Colleague, Vasily Shenshin.
Both of us learned how to use Autodesk Inventor. As a trial design project, my colleague drew and 3D printed a mushroom shaped keyring with a smiling face and I drew and 3D printed a model of the Queen's Tower, which stands at the centre of the campus.

We are currently looking for potential manufacturers of our new pipette, of which we have made a working prototype with a level of accuracy which is competitive to commercial pipettes. 
It consists largely of 3D printed and metal-machined parts and panels.
profile_positions.title: Innovation and Design

profile_positions.description:
Investigated and wrote a coursework paper on the effect of differing weather conditions at different altitudes on the structural density of Broom plants (Cytisus Scoparius) in the Sierra de Gredos mountains, West of Madrid, Spain.

Collected data in the field a structured, systematic way. Measured light intensity, wind speed, soil and air humidity.
Analysed the data collected to draw conclusions from it and wrote an extensive paper, backed by selected scientific literature.
profile_positions.title: Biology Field Research

profile_positions.description:
Among the first students admitted by audition at the Centre For Young Musicians (CYM) in the Netherlands- a centre for talented and aspiring young musicians.

-Participated as a violinist in a String Group, 2 Chamber Trios and a Piano-Violin duo. Sang as a bass in the choir and studied Music Theory and Aural interpretation.

Over the course of 5 years of attending CYM 3 hours a week, with frequent extra rehearsals, I learned to interact closely with other members of chamber groups and respond to subtle nuances in their playing. This also showed me the importance of close communication and team dynamics.

-Performed twice at the British Ambassador's residence; once in 2005 as one of a selected group of ABRSM students, once as part of a Violin-Piano duo with Harry King for the Queen's Diamond Jubilee Celebrations in 2012.

-Participated in the Eisteddfod Music Competition in March 2008 at the International School of The Hague (ISH).
profile_positions.title: Musician
